授業目的:
The purpose of this course is to provide those students who may have less learning experience with microeconomics or with the basic microeconomic principles at the undergraduate level. 

This course applies major economic analysis techniques to the business and industry. It is designed to provide students with a thorough understanding of business economics concepts. As such, the emphasis of the course is to learn how to use basic business economics concepts as a managerial tool to improve business decisions efficiency and profitability of firms.
到達目標:
1. To develop fundamental-level understanding of business economics;
2. To introduce tools and models that can facilitate analysis of real life business decision issues;
3. To gain an appreciation of how firms make economic decisions to achieve their objectives; 
4. To prepare students to critically think about topics related to monopoly markets, oligopoly, competitive strategy.
授業の概要・背景:
This course deals with economic issues which are related to many industries and firms. It provides
students with perspectives of economic and business decisions.
授業方法:
Lectures: The Instructor will give lectures on major concepts, issues and models. Case studies are provided.

The teaching and learning materials are mainly based on the textbook and supplementary readings. However, we will constantly use real world cases and newspaper articles for discussion in the class. Lecture notes and course materials will be uploaded on the course website or through email. 

There will be one quiz and one individual presentation and in-class final written exam (in the last class).

第1回:

Business economics: an overview
第6回:

Business objectives and competitive strategy
